course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Peoples and Cultures in Mainland Southeast Asia
course.description: This course aims to study the cultural diversity in Myanmar, Thailand, Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia, and the complex historical development of majority/minority relations and the formulation of cultural identities among different peoples on this borderland. Various cultural influences from India, China and Europe on mainland Southeast Asia, and strategies of indigenous peoples maintaining their cultures will be examined. The dynamic relations among religion, ethnicity, tourism and modernity will also be explored.

reviews.author: Teddy Bear
reviews.title: Nice professor !!!
reviews.comment_content:
The course mainly focuses on the cultural diversity in Myanmar, Thailand, Laos and Cambodia.

Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: Ancient Civilizations
Week 3: Hinduism and Buddhism
Week 4: Colonialism and Western Powers
Week 5: Nation-State Building
Week 6: Vietnam War and the Golden Triangle
Week 7: Cultures in Highland Southeast Asia
Week 8: Cultures in Laos and Cambodia
Week 9: Overseas Chinese Communities
Week 10: Nation States and Identities
Week 11: Tourism, Politics and Identities
Week 12: Conclusion: Modernity, centres and peripheries & final review
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a friendly and kind professor! If you do not understand the concepts, feel free to ask him. He will explain them to you in a detailed way.
After he finishes the ppt slides, he will play documentaries in class. It helps you to have a thorough understanding. Most of the important notes are on the ppt slides so no worries if you miss them in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Your hard work will pay off!!!
He will give you a final review and you need to prepare those questions before the final exam. If you do it, you definitely get a good grade!!!
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy for year 1-2 students. You have to write 2 documentary review papers, a 10-page (double space) term paper and a final exam. So don't be a deadline fighter! Remember to jot down notes when watching the documentary in class!
